description: Use natural English for responsibility names. Responsibilities should read like natural language method calls, using proper grammar and clear intent.

do.description: Write responsibilities in natural English that clearly express intent

guidance.description: Use verbs with clear nouns that read naturally
example: Calculates total value with market prices: Money, Holding, MarketPrice
Evaluates risk score: RiskScore, RiskModel, Holding
Calculates subtotal from items: Money, LineItem
Finds by order number: Order, OrderNumber
(Reads naturally: 'Portfolio calculates total value', 'Order finds by order number')

guidance.description: Use proper articles and prepositions when they improve clarity
example: Creates from rebalance recommendation: Trade, RebalanceRecommendation
Calculates execution price: Money, Symbol, MarketPrice, TradingFees
Calculates market value: Money, Symbol, MarketPrice
(Natural phrases: 'Creates from rebalance recommendation', 'Calculates execution price')

dont.description: Don't use awkward phrasing or overly technical grammar

guidance.description: Don't use awkward abbreviations or shorthand that doesn't read naturally
example: (Should be: Get holdings, Calculates total value, Finds by order number)

guidance.description: Don't use overly verbose or awkward phrasing
example: Performs the operation of getting all holdings: Holding (WRONG: verbose)
Executes calculation for determining total value: Money (WRONG: verbose)
(Should be: Get holdings: Holding, Calculates total value: Money, Holding)

guidance.description: Don't use technical jargon when simple English works
example: Instantiates line item collection: LineItem (WRONG: technical)
Retrieves authorization token: AuthorizationCode (WRONG: overly technical)
(Should be: Get line items: LineItem, Calculates subtotal: Money, Authorizes transaction: AuthorizationCode)
